intro: Galium jungermannioides, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring, which are followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
